body:
> It's a bit strange why didn't add annotations support?

I think you didn't follow how community works. There is nothing like `why not`. The features only exist if someone contributed it. That is all.
So, if you feel something is important, write a pull request with a proposal about the use case.
@sunOnly Any update?

> @sunOnly Any update?

There are added code in the skywalking-java . Submit it now

> @sunOnly Any update?

Bad network timeout submission failed
Usually, you need a VPN to submit codes to GitHub, I am afraid. It is unstable from time to time.

> I would like to help migrate the base docker images to `eclipse-temurin` ones.

Not sure whether you are talking the same thing. @wu-sheng is asking for verification on Java 17 but @lujiajing1126 is asking for arm Docker support, FWIW we already have ARM Docker images for OAP https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pkgs/container/skywalking%2Foap

Changing the base Docker image is not recommended IIRC, unless it's only for testing (E2E).
@kezhenxu94 `eclipse-temurin` is `adoptopenjdk`(https://adoptopenjdk.net/). I am thinking about whether we should adopt the latest temurin release. WDYT?
Another thing is, whether we should provide JDK17 runtime docker image on GitHub repo for testing?

> @kezhenxu94 `eclipse-temurin` is `adoptopenjdk`(https://adoptopenjdk.net/). I am thinking about whether we should adopt the latest temurin release. WDYT?

If you mean test the OAP on latest temurin release and make the tests pass, I'm +1

> Another thing is, whether we should provide JDK17 runtime docker image on GitHub repo for testing?

I can add a step to push that image

@kezhenxu94 Notice this from https://hub.docker.com/_/adoptopenjdk

```markdown
## DEPRECATION NOTICE
This image is officially deprecated in favor of the eclipse-temurin image, and will receive no further updates after 2021-08-01 (Aug 01, 2021). Please adjust your usage accordingly.
```

The base image should be updated too. And JDK17 runtime could be considered if it doesn't break release process.

> > I would like to help migrate the base docker images to `eclipse-temurin` ones.
> 
> Not sure whether you are talking the same thing. @wu-sheng is asking for verification on Java 17 but @lujiajing1126 is asking for arm Docker support, FWIW we already have ARM Docker images for OAP https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pkgs/container/skywalking%2Foap
> 
> Changing the base Docker image is not recommended IIRC, unless it's only for testing (E2E).

Yes. At the very beginning, I meant only the E2E parts.

Then due to the deprecation warning from the https://hub.docker.com/_/adoptopenjdk repo mentioned by @wu-sheng, I suppose we should migrate all base images to the recommended ones built by `eclipse-temurin`.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/96 should be approved first.

Anyhow fixed the PR and force pushed the changes.
When you face a submodule update in the upstream, your git(local) will prefer to keep your local version. So, in this time, you need to revert the local change.

@mrproliu CLI would be affected, we need an update after the merge. We may need a backend version detecting mechanism this time.

Relate to https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8477
No update in months.
No update in months.
All issues and discussions on GitHub must be in English.
And this is only a discussion. No debug or log could prove this is a bug.

Due to the downSampling in the OAP server side, we have to support writing data to a block older than the current open ones.

For example, we start the banyandb server at "2022-01-27T01:40:20Z", the oldest block may start from "2022-01-27T01:40:20Z" while the OAP server would send stream entities with timestamp "2022-01-27T01:00:00Z" due to the downSampling at hour level.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2568208/151276008-fc0675be-5c9a-4fc7-897b-be9df660877c.png)

> Due to the downSampling in the OAP server side, we have to support writing data to a block older than the current open ones.
> 
> For example, we start the banyandb server at "2022-01-27T01:40:20Z", the oldest block may start from "2022-01-27T01:40:20Z" while the OAP server would send stream entities with timestamp "2022-01-27T01:00:00Z" due to the downSampling at hour level.
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2568208/151276008-fc0675be-5c9a-4fc7-897b-be9df660877c.png)

Added this to the task list.
Same problem, hope it can be fixed quickly.
@xinnj @820465323 If no one intends to fix it on their own, everyone has to wait. This is how an open-source project works.

yeah,let me try
@wu-sheng Hi, How should I know which type of plugins need to be put into optional-plugins module?

Generally, if a plugin could impact the performance(such as collecting parameters, due to serialization costing), or generate many spans expectedly(such as Spring's bean annotation, it is unpredictable), then it is safer to be put in the optional. So, usually JDK rt.jar level instrumentation should be optional.
OK, I see. Thanks for your reply.

@wu-sheng Because of `post(event)` method parameter type is `Object`, so I can't define enhanced class in the instrumentation stage. So is there any way to enhance a class or inject a virtual field to the instance dynamically?

I am afraid not. Usually, you have to make a wrapper to host this `object` and context snapshot, and unwrap it to the original object in the event processor(or some consuming concept in `AsyncEventBus`.

I fixed them in https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/skywalking/nginx-lua/0.6.0/, but https://archive.apache.org/dist/skywalking/nginx-lua/0.6.0/ is not updated.

Hi @dcryans , thanks for reporting this and sharing the details, your fix with `try-except` looks kind of overkill to me and it might be expensive .

What about adding a condition `header_frame.properties.headers is not None` before the `for` loop so that we don't need to go into the loop if there is no header, otherwise it will be throwing and catching over and over again, that's unnecessary.

If you agree please directly file a pull request to apache/skywalking-python repo, thanks!

Hi @kezhenxu94,

Usually, from what I know, try/except (or catch in java) will be less expensive when everything goes well and more expensive if it goes bad

Since SkyWalking is adding headers to messages, I thought try except would be faster in most cases

Here's an example of try vs if:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2522005/cost-of-exception-handlers-in-python

Unless most people only instrument part of their stack? Then messages from uninstrumented apps would be more expensive.

Let me know what you prefer, then I'll send the PR.

> Hi @kezhenxu94,
> 
> Usually, from what I know, try/except (or catch in java) will be less expensive when everything goes well and more expensive if it goes bad
> 
> Since SkyWalking is adding headers to messages, I thought try except would be faster in most cases
> 
> Here's an example of try vs if:
> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2522005/cost-of-exception-handlers-in-python
> 
> Unless most people only instrument part of their stack? Then messages from uninstrumented apps would be more expensive.
> 
> Let me know what you prefer, then I'll send the PR.

Do you mean if the header exists the condition I suggested to add will contrarily pull down the performance but remain nearly the same with the `try-except`? If so, feel free to use `try-except` as you said the headers should exist for most cases.

You creat a fork repository under you account, create a branch and send pull request to the upstream repository, then we'll review and merge into the official repository.
URL, URI and HTTP method, evem with headers are in tags already. Tracing system has to work effectively in high traffic load, this new tag seems not worth.
In some cases, the request could be POST, and the request body would be huge, this tag is very likely causing potential memory issue for few use cases.

@kezhenxu94 possibly we can just achieve this with:

```yml
header:
  license:
    spdx-id: Apache-2.0
    content: |
      SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
```

thanks to SPDX license identifier is simple :)
If so, we can add a test and close this issue as provided out-of-the-box.
Also the link above is broken. It's now https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/using-SPDX-short-identifiers-in-source-files/.

> @kezhenxu94 possibly we can just achieve this with:
> 
> 
> 
> ```yml
> 
> header:
> 
>   license:
> 
>     spdx-id: Apache-2.0
> 
>     content: |
> 
>       SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
> 
> ```
> 
> 
> 
> thanks to SPDX license identifier is simple :)

In this example the spdx identifier is nothing special comparing to a plain header content though that will also satisfy your requirement. (BTW with `content` set, the `spdx-id` is simply ignored.)

@kezhenxu94 yes. What I propose here is that we don't have to implement something new to meet the original requirement. But add a test preventing regression, and when incoming users ask for verifying SPDX license identifier, tell them to do it in this way.

> URL, URI and HTTP method, evem with headers are in tags already. Tracing system has to work effectively in high traffic load, this new tag seems not worth.

You are right, seems I should change the code of skywalking UI, rather than skywakking agent..

> Rocketbot UI is replaced by the new [Booster UI](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-booster-ui) since 9.0.0 release.

So, we are establishing the booster UI in a new repo, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-booster-ui. This is not done yet. I would like to recommend you submitting a pull request after this UI is ready.
Closing this.

@Fine0830 is the PMC member initializing it. Our plan is around March, 99% of the backend is ready for it.

I am transferring this to the discussion, the `feature` request is about a solid solution.
Please update the changes.md in the root.

The liaison module is designed as the gateway of the banyandb server. It has the capacities of traffic routing, service discovering, and sharding. Banyandb's modules have a chance to run as a standalone process. To liaison's case, we have start-up a process where this module is only loaded. The idea likes the ingest node of Elasticsearch.

We could add the sharding feature to the liaison as our original design based on the above. I don't tend to support a client-side sharding in banyandb java client. Another critical downside of rich client solutions is the multi-language support. We have to implement the sharding feat in several clients, the command-line tool, and the UI. A thin-client path is better for us from my perspective.
@lujiajing1126 Pls submit the java client issues found in the stream module integration.

The latency is unstable even in high network quality. The [fallacies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallacies_of_distributed_computing) of distributed computing told us the network is always unreliable. So we should assume the latency will/must be inevitable. The replication of banyandb should introduce the consistency model to handle the latency, bandwidth, and other network issues.

Cassandra first introduces tune consistency to determine which consistency level they need. But I prefer the M3DB's [simplified version](https://m3db.io/docs/architecture/m3db/consistencylevels/#:~:text=M3DB%20provides%20variable%20consistency%20levels,handled%20at%20the%20client%20level.)  

Since the liaison is the gateway of the master and replicas, the consistency strategy could be its responsibility.

Yes, we will do the traffic routine in the Liaison. What I proposed here is a temporary solution. I don't push too hard on the cluster direction, as clearly, replication and data sync mechanism are more important.
This is a minimal step in the project establishment.
@lujiajing1126 You are a committer now, please pick the suitable labels and milestone for the issue(s).
Got it
`int64` should represent the millisecond. If protocol is expecting nanoseconds, how about we use timestamp rather than int64?

As you don't check the will contribute, this would be a discussion only.
Plugins are various and countless, we wouldn't track this as an feature requirement  as this would overload the issue tracker.
@honganan Besides submitting a pull request to fix this, I am feeling you should submit this bug to Dubbo too. Because the wrong metadata in RpcServiceContext is definitely unexpected.

I will fix it these two days as the test scenario need to be improved, and Perhaps it can't be saying as a bug for Dubbo, it's just a RPC framework and normally users just do nothing with `Context` when call another service. We should attention this but.
I am not very familiar with Dubbo 3.0, and it separates `RpcContext` to several Classes. May be after I will learn more about it and report the issue if needed.

The else branch:
```java
isConsumer = serviceContext.isConsumerSide();
```
at this time the `serviceContext` is still the provider side's, it seems understandable as the provider is not finished yet.
Let me ask, this seems a bug from my understanding.
I see it, Let's see how did they designed the Contexts.
@naah69 It would be better you could involve in this.

Hi @wu-sheng,
If it's still open, Can I give it a try?
Yes, this is still open. Welcome to contribute.
Assigned to you, welcome the fix.
@kezhenxu94 What is the timeout threshold value for now?

> @kezhenxu94 What is the timeout threshold value for now?

The default response timeout is 15s
It seems reasonable to expose this setting. After all, we had this before.

> It seems reasonable to expose this setting. After all, we had this before.

bro. i found it can be set by using -Dcom.linecorp.armeria.defaultResponseTimeoutMillis=15000 at startup.
Thanks for sharing. We prefer system environment variable to control, in order to be more cloud native

> > It seems reasonable to expose this setting. After all, we had this before.
> 
> bro. i found it can be set by using -Dcom.linecorp.armeria.defaultResponseTimeoutMillis=15000 at startup.

All Armeria/Netty options can be set in this way, but that requires users to be aware of the implementation and that's not portable because the implementation in SkyWalking is subject to change, example: we used ElasticSearch official client (that use HttpClient) and migrate to Armeria now.
